features.name: Burn
features.desc: At 1st level, a kineticist can overexert herself to channel more power than normal, pushing past the limit of what is safe for her body by accepting burn. Some of her wild talents allow her to accept burn in exchange for a greater effect, while others require her to accept a certain amount of burn to use that talent at all. For each point of burn she accepts, a kineticist takes (1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}) points of nonlethal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage can't be {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} by any means other than getting a full night's {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}, which removes all burn and associated nonlethal damage. Nonlethal damage from burn can't be reduced or redirected, and a kineticist incapable of taking nonlethal damage can't accept burn. A kineticist can accept only 1 point of burn per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This limit rises to 2 points of burn at 6th level, and rises by 1 additional point every 3 levels thereafter. A kineticist can't choose to accept burn if it would put her total number of points of burn higher than (3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), though she can be forced to accept more burn from a source outside her control. A kineticist who has accepted burn never benefits from abilities that allow her to ignore or alter the effects she receives from nonlethal damage.

features.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency
features.desc: Kineticists are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} and light armor, but not shields.

features.name: Elemental Focus
features.desc: At 1st level, a kineticist chooses one primary element on which to focus. This element determines how she accesses the raw power of the Ethereal Plane, and grants her access to specific wild talents and additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. She gains her selected element's basic utility wild talent (basic aerokinesis, etc.) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} wild talent.

features.name: Infusion
features.desc:
At 1st level, a kineticist gains an infusion wild talent from the list of options available based on her elemental focus. She gains additional infusions at 3rd, 5th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 17th, and 19th levels. By using infusions along with her kinetic blasts, a kineticist can alter her kinetic blasts to suit her needs. Infusions come in two types, each of which changes a kinetic blast differently: a substance infusion causes an additional effect, while a form infusion causes the kinetic blast to manifest in a different way. Each infusion can alter only certain kinds of kinetic blasts, which are listed in its Associated Blasts entry. Each time the kineticist uses one of her kinetic blast wild talents, she can apply up to one associated form infusion and up to one associated substance infusion.
Some infusions change the {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} required to activate a kinetic blast or entirely transform the kinetic blast's normal effects.
The burn cost listed in each infusion's Burn entry is added to the burn cost of the kinetic blast the infusion modifies.
The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against an infusion is based on the associated kinetic blast's effective {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} level, not the level of the infusion. The DCs for form infusions are calculated using the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. When a kineticist modifies a kinetic blast with a form infusion and a substance infusion that both require saving throws, each target first attempts a saving throw against the form infusion. If a target succeeds and a successful save negates the infusion's effects, the entire kinetic blast is negated; otherwise, the target then attempts a saving throw against the substance infusion. If a kineticist's form and substance infusions both alter the kinetic blast's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, apply the substance infusion's alteration first.

features.name: Kinetic Blast
features.desc:
At 1st level, a kineticist gains a kinetic blast wild talent of her choice. This kinetic blast must be a simple blast that matches her element.
As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the kineticist can unleash a kinetic blast at a single target in close range. She must have at least one hand free to aim the blast. All {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from a kinetic blast is treated as magic for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Kinetic blasts count as a type of weapon for the purpose of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Weapon Focus. The kineticist is never considered to be wielding or gripping the kinetic blast, and she can't use Vital Strike feats with kinetic blasts. Even the weakest kinetic blast involves a sizable mass of elemental matter or energy, so kinetic blasts always deal full damage to swarms of any {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} (though only area blasts deal extra damage to swarms).
Each simple blast is either a physical blast or an energy blast.
Physical blasts are {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}+1 + the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, increasing by 1d6+1 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}Spell resistance{/g} doesn't apply against physical blasts.
Energy blasts are ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to 1d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 1d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Composite blasts combine elements to form a new blast. When a kineticist gains a new element through expanded element, she gains access to all composite blasts for which she qualifies.
Most composite blasts are either physical or energy blasts, like simple blasts.
Physical composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6+2 + the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6+2 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Energy composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.

features.name: Kinetic Blast
features.desc:
At 1st level, a kineticist gains a kinetic blast wild talent of her choice. This kinetic blast must be a simple blast that matches her element.
As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the kineticist can unleash a kinetic blast at a single target in close range. She must have at least one hand free to aim the blast. All {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from a kinetic blast is treated as magic for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Kinetic blasts count as a type of weapon for the purpose of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} such as Weapon Focus. The kineticist is never considered to be wielding or gripping the kinetic blast, and she can't use Vital Strike feats with kinetic blasts. Even the weakest kinetic blast involves a sizable mass of elemental matter or energy, so kinetic blasts always deal full damage to swarms of any {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} (though only area blasts deal extra damage to swarms).
Each simple blast is either a physical blast or an energy blast.
Physical blasts are {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}+1 + the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, increasing by 1d6+1 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st. {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}Spell resistance{/g} doesn't apply against physical blasts.
Energy blasts are ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} that deal an amount of damage equal to 1d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 1d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Composite blasts combine elements to form a new blast. When a kineticist gains a new element through expanded element, she gains access to all composite blasts for which she qualifies.
Most composite blasts are either physical or energy blasts, like simple blasts.
Physical composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6+2 + the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6+2 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.
Energy composite blasts deal an amount of damage equal to 2d6 + 1/2 the kineticist's Constitution modifier, increasing by 2d6 for every 2 kineticist levels beyond 1st.

features.name: Wild Talents
features.desc: A kineticist can use wild talents — magical abilities similar to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} but drawn from the kineticist's innate psychic talent and usable at will. Wild talents are typically {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} (though some are supernatural abilities), and take a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to use unless otherwise noted. Every wild talent has an effective spell level. A kineticist can always select 1st-level wild talents, but she can select a wild talent of a higher level only if her kineticist level is at least double the wild talent's effective spell level. Kinetic blast and defense wild talents are always considered to have an effective spell level equal to 1/2 the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} (to a maximum effective spell level of 9th at kineticist level 18th). Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against a wild talent is equal to 10 + the wild talent's effective spell level + the kineticist's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. The kineticist uses her Constitution modifier on all {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} for wild talents. In addition to the wild talents she gains from her other class features, at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a kineticist selects a new utility wild talent from the list of options available to her. A kineticist can select only universal wild talents or those that match her element.

features.name: Elemental Overflow
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a kineticist's body surges with energy from her chosen element whenever she accepts burn. In addition, she receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} with kinetic blasts equal to the total number of points of burn she currently has, to a maximum bonus of +1 for every 3 kineticist levels she possesses. She also receives a bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blast equal to double the bonus on attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
As a kineticist's body becomes more and more suffused with her element, she begins to gain more powerful benefits.
Starting at 6th level, whenever she has at least 3 points of burn, the kineticist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} bonus to two physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} of her choice. She also gains a chance to ignore the effects of a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or sneak attack equal to 5% for every current point of burn. At 11th level, whenever the kineticist has at least 5 points of burn, these bonuses increase to a +4 size bonus to one physical ability score of her choice and a +2 size bonus to each of her other two physical ability scores.
At 16th level, whenever the kineticist has at least 7 points of burn, these bonuses increase to a +6 size bonus to one physical ability score of her choice, a +4 size bonus to a second physical ability score of her choice, and a +2 size bonus to the remaining physical ability score.

features.name: Metakinesis — Empowered
features.desc: At 5th level, a kineticist gains the ability to alter her kinetic blasts as if with metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by accepting burn. By accepting 1 point of burn, she can empower her kinetic blast (as if using Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}). At 9th level, by accepting 2 points of burn, she can maximize her kinetic blast as if using Maximize Spell. At 13th level, by accepting 3 points of burn, she can quicken her kinetic blast as if using Quicken Spell.

features.name: Expanded Element
features.desc:
At 7th level, a kineticist learns to use another element or expands her understanding of her own element. She can choose any element, including her primary element. She gains one of that element's simple blast wild talents that she does not already possess, if any. She also gains all composite blast wild talents whose prerequisites she meets. She doesn't gain the defensive wild talent of the expanded element unless she later selects it with the expanded defense utility wild talent.
At 15th level, the kineticist can either select a new element or expand her understanding of her original element. She can't select the same element she selected at 7th level. She gains all the benefits from her new expanded element as listed above.

features.name: Metakinesis — Maximized
features.desc: At 5th level, a kineticist gains the ability to alter her kinetic blasts as if with metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by accepting burn. By accepting 1 point of burn, she can empower her kinetic blast (as if using Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}). At 9th level, by accepting 2 points of burn, she can maximize her kinetic blast as if using Maximize Spell. At 13th level, by accepting 3 points of burn, she can quicken her kinetic blast as if using Quicken Spell.

features.name: Supercharge
features.desc: At 11th level, when using gather power as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, a kineticist can reduce the total burn cost of a single wild talent by 2 points instead of 1. When using gather power for 1 full {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, she can reduce the burn cost of a single wild talent by 3 points instead of 2.

features.name: Metakinesis — Quicken
features.desc: At 5th level, a kineticist gains the ability to alter her kinetic blasts as if with metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} by accepting burn. By accepting 1 point of burn, she can empower her kinetic blast (as if using Empower {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}). At 9th level, by accepting 2 points of burn, she can maximize her kinetic blast as if using Maximize Spell. At 13th level, by accepting 3 points of burn, she can quicken her kinetic blast as if using Quicken Spell.

features.name: Expanded Element
features.desc:
At 7th level, a kineticist learns to use another element or expands her understanding of her own element. She can choose any element, including her primary element. She gains one of that element's simple blast wild talents that she does not already possess, if any. She also gains all composite blast wild talents whose prerequisites she meets. She doesn't gain the defensive wild talent of the expanded element unless she later selects it with the expanded defense utility wild talent.
At 15th level, the kineticist can either select a new element or expand her understanding of her original element. She can't select the same element she selected at 7th level. She gains all the benefits from her new expanded element as listed above.

features.name: Composite Specialization
features.desc:
At 16th level, a kineticist becomes more adept at creating composite blasts. She reduces the burn cost of all composite blasts by 1 point.
This can't reduce the cost of a composite blast below 0 points.

features.name: Metakinetic Master
features.desc: At 19th level, a kineticist chooses one type of metakinesis, such as empower or quicken. She reduces the burn cost of that metakinesis by 1 point (to a minimum of 0 points).

features.name: Infusion Specialization
features.desc:
At 5th level, whenever a kineticist uses one or more infusions with a blast, she reduces the combined burn cost of the infusions by 1. This can't reduce the total cost of the infusions used below 0.
She reduces the burn cost by 1 additional point at 8th, 11th, 14th, 17th, and 20th levels.

features.name: Air
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of air are called aerokineticists. Aerokineticists often control air flow or electricity, specializing in {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}mobility{/g} and ranged combat.

features.name: Air Blast
features.desc:
Element: air
Type: simple blast
Level: —
Burn: 0
Blast Type: physical
{g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}
You batter a single foe with a gust of air.

features.name: Air Class Skills
features.desc: An aerokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Enveloping Winds
features.desc: You constantly surround yourself with a whirling torrent of air, crackling arcs of lightning, or both to protect yourself from {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. All ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made with physical weapons suffer a 20% miss chance against you. This ability has no effect on ray attacks. The miss chance increases by 5% for every 5 kineticist levels you possess beyond 2nd. By accepting 1 point of burn, you can increase the miss chance by 5% until the next time your burn is removed. You can continue to accept points of burn to increase the miss chance further, up to a maximum of 75%.

features.name: Earth
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of earth are called geokineticists. Geokineticists manipulate the earth itself, and they are masters of defensive techniques.

features.name: Earth Blast
features.desc:
Element: earth
Type: simple blast
Level: —
Burn: 0
Blast Type: physical
{g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}, piercing, and slashing
You shape earth into clumps or shards and send them flying at a foe.

features.name: Earth Class Skills
features.desc: A geokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Flesh of Stone
features.desc:
Element: earth
Type: defense
Level: —
Burn: 0
Your skin hardens like stone, dampening the impact of most {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/adamantine. This DR increases by 1 for every 2 kineticist levels you possess beyond 2nd. By accepting 1 point of burn, you can increase the DR by 1 until the next time your burn is removed, to a maximum DR equal to your kineticist level.

features.name: Fire
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of fire are called pyrokineticists. Pyrokineticists wield elemental fire as a potent weapon, and they possess a powerful offense.

features.name: Fire Blast
features.desc:
Element: fire
Type: simple blast
Level: —
Burn: 0
Blast Type: energy
{g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g}: fire
You unleash a gout of flickering fire to burn a single foe.

features.name: Class Skills
features.desc: A pyrokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Searing Flesh
features.desc:
Element: fire
Type: defense
Level: —
Burn: 0
Your body becomes painfully hot. Whenever a creature hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} or an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, that creature takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per 4 kineticist levels you possess (minimum 1 point of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}). A creature in a grapple with you takes double this amount of damage at the end of each of its turns.
By accepting 1 point of burn, you can increase this damage by 1 point per 4 kineticist levels you possess until the next time your burn is removed. You can increase the damage in this way up to seven times.

features.name: Water
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of water are called hydrokineticists. Hydrokineticists master the flow of water or the numbing chill of cold, and they are known for their versatility and flowing forms, like the ever-changing currents.

features.name: Water Blast
features.desc: A hydrokineticist can select either cold blast or water blast as her simple blast. She gains one of them when she first selects water, and must select water again with expanded element to gain the other.

features.name: Class Skills
features.desc: A hydrokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Shroud of Water
features.desc:
Element: water
Type: defense
Level: —
Burn: 0
You surround yourself with a shroud of water, ice, or both that protects you from harm. The shroud can either cover your body, functioning as armor, or float around you and block {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, functioning as a shield. It grants either a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} or a +2 shield bonus to AC, and you can change the type of bonus as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 kineticist levels you possess beyond 2nd. By accepting 1 point of burn, You can increase the bonus by 1 until the next time your burn is removed. You can increase the bonus multiple times in this way, but it can't be increased by more than 50% of its starting value.
When you change the shroud to grant a shield bonus, any bonus in excess of this limit doesn't apply, but it remains if you change the shroud's bonus type again.

features.name: Air
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of air are called aerokineticists. Aerokineticists often control air flow or electricity, specializing in {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}mobility{/g} and ranged combat.

features.name: Air Blast
features.desc:
Element: air
Type: simple blast
Level: —
Burn: 0
Blast Type: physical
{g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}
You batter a single foe with a gust of air.

features.name: Earth
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of earth are called geokineticists. Geokineticists manipulate the earth itself, and they are masters of defensive techniques.

features.name: Earth Blast
features.desc:
Element: earth
Type: simple blast
Level: —
Burn: 0
Blast Type: physical
{g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g}: {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}, piercing, and slashing

Type: defense
Level: —
Burn: 0
Your body becomes painfully hot. Whenever a creature hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} or an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, that creature takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per 4 kineticist levels you possess (minimum 1 point of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}). A creature in a grapple with you takes double this amount of damage at the end of each of its turns.
By accepting 1 point of burn, you can increase this damage by 1 point per 4 kineticist levels you possess until the next time your burn is removed. You can increase the damage in this way up to seven times.

features.name: Water
features.desc: Kineticists who focus on the element of water are called hydrokineticists. Hydrokineticists master the flow of water or the numbing chill of cold, and they are known for their versatility and flowing forms, like the ever-changing currents.

features.name: Class Skills
features.desc: A hydrokineticist adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Water Blast
features.desc: A hydrokineticist can select either cold blast or water blast as her simple blast. She gains one of them when she first selects water, and must select water again with expanded element to gain the other.

features.name: Shroud of Water
features.desc:
Element: water
Type: defense
Level: —
Burn: 0
You surround yourself with a shroud of water, ice, or both that protects you from harm. The shroud can either cover your body, functioning as armor, or float around you and block {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, functioning as a shield. It grants either a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} or a +2 shield bonus to AC, and you can change the type of bonus as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 kineticist levels you possess beyond 2nd. By accepting 1 point of burn, You can increase the bonus by 1 until the next time your burn is removed. You can increase the bonus multiple times in this way, but it can't be increased by more than 50% of its starting value.
When you change the shroud to grant a shield bonus, any bonus in excess of this limit doesn't apply, but it remains if you change the shroud's bonus type again.

features.name: Elemental Focus
features.desc: At 1st level, a kineticist chooses one primary element on which to focus. This element determines how she accesses the raw power of the Ethereal Plane, and grants her access to specific wild talents and additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}. She gains her selected element's basic utility wild talent (basic aerokinesis, etc.) as a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} wild talent.

features.name: Elemental Blade
features.desc: At 1st level, a kinetic knight gains the kinetic blade form infusion, and it costs 0 points of burn instead of 1 point. She can't use her kinetic blast without the kinetic blade form infusion or an infusion that lists kinetic blade as a prerequisite.

features.name: Kinetic Warrior
features.desc: The kinetic knight can use her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score in place of her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score when qualifying for combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. This ability counts as having Combat Expertise for the purpose of feat prerequisites.

features.name: Elemental Bastion
features.desc:
At 1st level, the kinetic knight becomes proficient with medium and heavy armor and shields (except tower shields).
A kinetic knight gains the elemental defense ability at 4th level, rather than 2nd.
This ability alters elemental defense.

features.name: Knight's Resolve
features.desc:
Starting at 3rd level, the kinetic knight gains resolve that he can call upon to endure even the most devastating wounds and afflictions. He can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day for every two kinetic knight levels beyond 3rd.
Determined: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the kinetic knight can spend one use of his resolve to remove the fatigued, shaken, or sickened condition. If the kinetic knight is at least 11th level, he can alternatively remove the exhausted, frightened, nauseated, or staggered condition.
Resolute: Whenever the kinetic knight is required to make a Fortitude or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, he can spend one use of his resolve as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result.
This ability replaces the kineticist infusion gained at 3rd level and supercharge.

features.name: Kinetic Blade
features.desc:
Element: universal
Type: form infusion
Level: 1
Burn: 1
Associated Blasts: any
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving Throw{/g}: none
You form a weapon using your kinetic abilities. You create a nonreach, light or {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}one-handed{/g} weapon in your hand formed of pure energy or elemental matter. The kinetic blade's shape is purely cosmetic and doesn't affect the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat range, or critical multiplier of the kinetic blade, nor does it grant the kinetic blade any weapon special features.
You can use this form infusion once as part of an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, a charge action, or a full-attack action in order to make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with your kinetic blade. Since it's part of another action (and isn't an action itself), using this wild talent doesn't provoke any additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. The kinetic blade deals your kinetic blast damage on each hit (applying any modifiers to your kinetic blast's damage as normal, but not your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier). The blade disappears at the end of your turn. The weapon deals the same {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}damage type{/g} that your kinetic blast deals, and it interacts with {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} as normal for a blast of its type. The kinetic blade doesn't add the damage {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from elemental overflow.

features.name: Gather Power
features.desc: If she has both hands free, a kineticist can gather energy or elemental matter as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Gathering power in this way allows the kineticist to reduce the total burn cost of a blast wild talent she uses in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by 1 point. The kineticist can instead gather power for 1 full round in order to reduce the total burn cost of a blast wild talent used on her next turn by 2 points (to a minimum of 0 points). If she does so, she can also gather power as a move {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} during her next turn to reduce the burn cost by a total of 3 points. This ability can never reduce the burn cost of a wild talent below 0 points.

features.name: Burn
features.desc: At 1st level, a kineticist can overexert herself to channel more power than normal, pushing past the limit of what is safe for her body by accepting burn. Some of her wild talents allow her to accept burn in exchange for a greater effect, while others require her to accept a certain amount of burn to use that talent at all. For each point of burn she accepts, a kineticist takes (1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}) points of nonlethal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage can't be {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} by any means other than getting a full night's {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g}, which removes all burn and associated nonlethal damage. Nonlethal damage from burn can't be reduced or redirected, and a kineticist incapable of taking nonlethal damage can't accept burn. A kineticist can accept only 1 point of burn per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This limit rises to 2 points of burn at 6th level, and rises by 1 additional point every 3 levels thereafter. A kineticist can't choose to accept burn if it would put her total number of points of burn higher than (3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), though she can be forced to accept more burn from a source outside her control. A kineticist who has accepted burn never benefits from abilities that allow her to ignore or alter the effects she receives from nonlethal damage.

features.name: Dark Studies
features.desc:
A dark elementalist's base {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from the kineticist class is equal to 2 + 1/2 her kineticist level, and her base Reflex and Fortitude save bonuses are equal to 1/3 her kineticist level. She gains all Knowledge and Lore {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} as class skills.
A dark elementalist uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the DCs of Constitution-based wild talents, the durations of wild talents with Constitution-based durations, her bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and any other Constitution-based effects of all her wild talents.
This alters the kineticist's class skills and base saving throws and the key {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} of wild talents.

features.name: Soul Power
features.desc:
A dark elementalist uses the souls of others to protect herself from the dangers of burn. She can't choose to accept burn if doing so would raise her total number of points of burn above 3. However, a number of times per day equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} she can gather up the souls of dead creatures with HD sum equal to or higher than her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}. When she does, some of her existing burn is unloaded into the departing souls, racking it with unspeakable torment, but reducing her current burn total by 1 point.
A dark elementalist gains {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} from elemental overflow based on how many times that day she has successfully used soul power to rack souls, rather than based on her current burn total. For instance, a 9th-level dark elementalist who had used soul power three or more times during the course of the day would add a +3 bonus on attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} and a +6 bonus on damage rolls. A dark elementalist does not gain {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} bonuses to physical {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g} or a chance to ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks from elemental overflow.
This ability alters burn and elemental overflow and replaces internal buffer.

features.name: Emotional Intensity
features.desc: A psychokineticist uses his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine his {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the DCs of Constitution-based wild talents, the durations of wild talents with Constitution-based durations, his {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and other Constitution-based effects of all his wild talents.

features.name: Mind Burn
features.desc:
A psychokineticist's mind strains when he overtaxes himself. He takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and Wisdom-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} for each point of burn he has accepted, rather than taking nonlethal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from burn. He can accept an amount of burn equal to his Wisdom modifier (rather than 3 + his Wisdom modifier). Otherwise, his burn works just like a normal kineticist's.
This ability alters burn.

features.name: Wrack
features.desc: At 1st level, a blood kineticist can use her abilities to wrack a target within 30 feet, harming the target by manipulating its blood from the inside. The target takes half the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the blood kineticist's blast, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to reduce that amount to 1/4 normal damage, but the damage is untyped and ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. This is a 1st-level form infusion that costs 0 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.

features.name: Bleeding Infusion
features.desc: At 5th level, a blood kineticist can infuse her blasts with a vicious power that causes internal or external bleeding. On a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}, the target takes 1 point of bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every die of the blast's damage. This is a 2nd-level substance infusion that costs 2 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.

features.name: Blood Blast
features.desc: The first time a blood kineticist selects water with expanded element, she doesn't gain the cold simple blast or the ice composite blast; instead, she gains the blood composite blast, which costs 2 points of burn. A blood blast is a physical blast that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. It is associated with the same infusions as the water blast.

features.name: Gut-Wrenching Infusion
features.desc: At 9th level, a blood kineticist can infuse her blasts with the ability to manipulate her opponent's insides to the point of impairing their function. On a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}, the target is sickened for 1 minute. This is a 4th-level substance infusion that costs 3 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.

features.name: Vampiric Infusion
features.desc:
At 11th level, a blood kineticist can drain the vitality from her enemy's blood to restore her own.
If her blast hits (or the enemy fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against a blast without an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}) the blood kineticist can activate the kinetic {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healer{/g} utility wild talent without paying the burn cost. This is a 5th-level substance infusion that costs 3 points of burn and can be used with water and blood blasts.

features.name: Blood Mastery
features.desc: At 20th level, a blood kineticist, because of her utter control over her own blood, is immune to bleed, poisons, diseases, and the sickened and nauseated conditions.

features.name: Mental Prowess
features.desc:
An overwhelming soul's mind is strong enough to protect her body from the stress of channeling the elements. However, in exchange, she is unable to push her limits quite as far as other kineticists.
She can't choose to accept burn, though she can use wild talents with a burn cost if she can reduce that cost to 0 points with abilities such as gather power and infusion specialization. At 6th level, once per day, she can reduce the total burn cost of any wild talent by 1.
She can use this ability an additional time per day at 10th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

features.name: Mind Over Matter
features.desc: An overwhelming soul uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier to determine her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with wild talents, the DCs of Constitution based wild talents, the duration of wild talents with a Constitution-based duration, her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} for wild talents, and the other Constitution based effects of all her wild talents.

features.name: Overwhelming Power
features.desc:
At 3rd level, an overwhelming soul gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blasts. The damage bonus doesn't apply to kinetic blade, kinetic whip, or other infusions that don't apply the damage bonus from elemental overflow.
This bonus increases by 1 at 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter.

features.name: Mental Prowess
features.desc:
At 6th level, once per day, she can reduce the total burn cost of any wild talent by 1.
She can use this ability an additional time per day at 10th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

features.name: Burnout
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a kineticist's body surges with energy from her chosen element whenever she accepts burn. In addition, she receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} with kinetic blasts equal to the total number of points of burn she currently has, to a maximum bonus of +1 for every 3 kineticist levels she possesses. She also receives a bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} with her kinetic blast equal to double the bonus on attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
Furthermore, elemental engine, while being at maximum burn, doubles those bonuses and when using gather power she reduces the burn cost by 1 additional point.

features.name: Elemental Burnout
features.desc:
Starting at 7th level, elemental engine gains additional benefits while at maximum burn, depending on the element they chose at 1st level.
If the chosen element was air, you gain +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with electricity descriptor. Additionally, you gain immunity to ground-based spells and abilities.
If the chosen element was earth, you gain +2 saving throw bonus against spells with acid descriptor. Additionally, you gain +4 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against trip, bull rush and pull {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
If the chosen element was fire, you gain +2 saving throw bonus against spells with fire descriptor. Additionally, you gain a +20 enhancement bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
If the chosen element was water, you gain +2 saving throw bonus against spells with cold descriptor. Additionally, any enemy striking you in melee combat with a non-{g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} melee weapon must make a Fortitude saving throw ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the kineticist level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) or become slowed, as per slow spell, for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Greater Elemental Burnout
features.desc:
Starting at 13th level, elemental engine gains more benefits while at maximum burn, depending on the element they chose at 1st level.
If the chosen element was air, you gain additional +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with electricity descriptor. Additionally, you are under effect of Freedom of Movement effect.
If the chosen element was earth, you gain additional +2 saving throw bonus against spells with acid descriptor. Additionally, you gain immunity against trip, bull rush and pull {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
If the chosen element was fire, you gain additional +2 saving throw bonus against spells with fire descriptor. Additionally, you are under Haste effect.
If the chosen element was water, you gain additional +2 saving throw bonus against spells with cold descriptor. Additionally, any enemy in 10ft radius must make a Fortitude saving throw ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the kineticist level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} or become slowed, as per slow spell, for 1 round.

name: Kineticist
desc:
Kineticists are living channels for elemental matter and energy, manipulating the world around them by drawing upon inner reserves from their own bodies. Kineticists often awaken to their kinetic abilities during a violent or traumatic experience, releasing their power involuntarily. As kinetic power is seldom inherited, kineticists are rarely able to find mentors to guide them, so they must delve into these mysteries on their own to learn to control their gifts.
Kineticists generally use their powers to assail their foes from range, but based on the way their talents develop, they can channel their kinetic abilities for a variety of situations. Kineticists are usually quite different from their families and friends, so they often strike out on their own or alongside others with extraordinary talents.

archetypes.name: Dark Elementalist
archetypes.desc: Some kineticists who are loathe to suffer the consequences of channeling their power study the darkest esoteric energies of the planes and use souls to fuel their occult might. The spiritual tortures these dark elementalists inflict upon their victims' souls are horrifically selfish acts on par with the actions of daemons.

archetypes.name: Psychokineticist
archetypes.desc: While most kineticists channel elemental power through their bodies, rare kineticists channel such power through their minds. Psychokineticists lack strong spirit, and so this energy ravages their minds but unleashes power locked in their ruptured emotions. Sometimes a psychokineticist inadvertently unleashes his power when he experiences an outburst of strong emotion, potentially making a psychokineticist an outcast or even an accidental killer.

archetypes.name: Kinetic Knight
archetypes.desc: A kinetic knight dons armor and wields a blade of elemental energy. Kinetic knights are rare in the Inner Sea region, but not unknown; many realize their elemental powers while training for battle.

archetypes.name: Blood Kineticist
archetypes.desc: To a blood kineticist, the water in a creature's blood is just like any other sort, and she uses that knowledge to brutal ends.

archetypes.name: Overwhelming Soul
archetypes.desc: Some kineticists have such a powerful personality that they can seize control of their element with their minds alone, without endangering their bodies.

archetypes.name: Elemental Engine
archetypes.desc: Some kineticists use the overflowing elemental power seeping through their bodies to manifest additional powers.
